author: sky.cactus
content: Minor correction: current L2s do not inherit the security of L1 because they are all centralized/controlled.  Hypothetical future L2s will.

author: m.kalinin
content: Obviously, `eth_getWork` (and other pow-related methods) is deprecated by the Merge, though, there is no proposal on making this deprecation into the spec. I haven't seen any proposals on renaming `eth_coinbase` either

author: syentist.
content: Minor addendum: if the core protocol was able to deliver execution sharding on time, users wouldn't have to be exposed to so called "centralised/controlled" L2s. And guess what? With every delay of the merge (for security reasons, ofc ðŸ˜‰), resulting in delay of Shanghai and 4844, L2s will be forced to switch to third party DA layers instead of eth L1 to settle data txs, to cut down on fees. Third party DA layers which are "centralised/controlled". And once again, we will blame these third party protocols for being less safe instead of looking in the mirror and reflecting that the core L1 roadmap being unable to deliver on time gave rise to these insecure outsourcings in the first place
